senses.de: A strong feeling of excitement or happiness
senses.ex: She got a thrill from skydiving

Tips.title: Positive Emotion
Tips.description: Used to describe experiences or activities that give a very happy feeling.
Tips.example: Seeing her childhood photos brought a thrill to her heart.

Tips.title: Achievement Elation
Tips.description: Often used when someone achieves something and feels a burst of happiness.
Tips.example: Winning the race gave him an unmatched thrill.

Tips.title: Hobbies and Interests
Tips.description: Refers to personal interests that make one feel especially excited or alive.
Tips.example: He finds a thrill in collecting rare stamps.

senses.de: To cause to experience excitement or happiness
senses.ex: His stories about his travels thrilled us

Tips.title: Sharing Excitement
Tips.description: When someone's actions or words make others feel excited.
Tips.example: Her passionate speech thrilled the audience.

Tips.title: Response to Art
Tips.description: People may use it to express how they are moved by music, movies, or performance.
Tips.example: The orchestra's performance thrilled me to the core.

senses.de: A sudden feeling of fear or excitement
senses.ex: He felt a thrill of fear as the door slowly opened

Tips.title: Intense Anticipation
Tips.description: Refers to the mix of fear and excitement one feels before a significant event.
Tips.example: She felt a thrill before the curtain rose on her first play.

Tips.title: Negative Surprise
Tips.description: Can indicate a sudden, often negative, surprise that causes a strong reaction.
Tips.example: A thrill went down his spine when he heard the strange noise.

senses.de: In medical term, it's a vibration felt on the chest wall
senses.ex: The doctor detected a thrill in the patient's chest

Tips.title: Medical Context
Tips.description: Specifically in medicine, it's about feeling abnormal vibrations caused by turbulent blood flow.
Tips.example: The cardiologist was concerned about the thrill she felt in the patient's pulse.

Tips.title: Technical Term
Tips.description: Remember, this term is technical and not used in casual conversation unless discussing health.
Tips.example: The medical student learned how to detect a thrill during a physical examination.

Buzz.wordDefinition:
Buzz refers to a feeling of excitement that's often brief or fleeting. It's like a burst of energy or enthusiasm that you might get from a new experience or activity.

For example, if someone says they got a buzz from riding a roller coaster, it means they experienced a rush of adrenaline or a sense of positive energy during the ride.

Buzz is applicable when you feel a brief or fleeting moment of excitement, while thrill is applicable when you feel a sustained feeling of enjoyment or excitement.

Delight.wordDefinition:
Delight means to experience great pleasure or satisfaction.

Delight is more of a gentle, peaceful emotion.

Delight is a feeling of pleasure or contentment, while thrill is a feeling of excitement or adrenaline. Delight is applicable for pleasant or enjoyable experiences, while thrill is applicable for experiences that involve a rush or surge of excitement.

Euphoria.wordDefinition:
Euphoria is a feeling of intense joy and happiness that may last for a longer time, while thrill is a sudden feeling of excitement and pleasure that is short-lived.

Euphoria is often associated with achieving a long-term goal or reaching a significant milestone in life, whereas thrill can be felt in the moment, such as during a thrilling ride or a daring adventure.

Euphoria is applicable in moments of achievement or accomplishment, while thrill is applicable in moments of excitement or adventure.

Excitement.wordDefinition:
Excitement and thrill are both emotions that relate to feelings of enthusiasm and adventure.

However, excitement tends to be a more general feeling of enthusiasm, while thrill is more specific and often associated with a physical experience.

For example, you might feel excitement before going on a vacation or starting a new job, but you might feel a thrill when doing something like skydiving or riding a roller coaster.

Excitement can be applied to a wider range of experiences, whereas a thrill is typically reserved for more intense or exhilarating activities.

Excitement is a more general feeling of enthusiasm while thrill is a specific feeling of excitement associated with a more intense or adventurous experience.

Exhilarate.wordDefinition:
Both exhilarate and thrill describe a feeling of excitement, but they are used slightly differently.

Exhilarate is more commonly used to describe a feeling of invigoration or stimulation caused by something that is challenging, difficult or emotional.

For example, one might say "the thrill of rock climbing exhilarates me" to convey the sense of excitement and challenge that the sport brings.

Exhilarate describes the positive feeling that comes from being challenged or emotionally moved, while thrill describes any intense feeling of excitement or pleasure.

Joy.wordDefinition:
Joy typically refers to a feeling of happiness or contentment that is steady and long-lasting, often associated with overall life satisfaction.

Joy can be experienced in everyday life, while thrill is usually linked to more heightened, unusual situations.

Pleasure.wordDefinition:
Pleasure refers to a feeling of enjoyment or satisfaction, usually obtained from something that we like or enjoy doing regularly.

Thrill refers to a strong and intense feeling of excitement or pleasure, often accompanied by a rush of adrenaline.

Pleasure is a milder feeling of enjoyment that can be obtained from regular activities, while thrill is a more intense feeling of excitement that is associated with risky or adventurous activities.

Rush.wordDefinition:
Rush refers to the feeling of excitement one gets from doing something quickly or urgently. It's like a sudden surge of energy or adrenaline.

Rush can be applied when someone is in a hurry, or rushed, to do something.

Rush is more about urgency and speed, while thrill is about excitement and danger.

Stimulate.wordDefinition:
Stimulate means to encourage or arouse activity or interest in a particular thing. It is applicable when you are trying to motivate someone to do something or if you want to increase their enthusiasm for a certain topic or subject.

Stimulate is about motivation and interest, while thrill is about intense excitement and enjoyment.

Tingle.wordDefinition:
Tingle refers to a feeling of slight numbness or pins and needles sensation that is often felt in the body.

Thrill describes a positive feeling of excitement, while tingle is a physical sensation that can have either positive or negative connotations depending on the context.

quotes.Text: That was the biggest thrill, going over to these guy's houses and having them want me to practice with them and they would show me a lot of stuff, which was really advanced stuff to me at my age.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Freddie Hubbard

quotes.Text: The thrill of acting is making a character real. Modeling is the opposite of real. It's being fake in front of the camera.
quotes.Title: English Model
quotes.Name: Cara Delevingne

quotes.Text: I was thrilled when a designer shop assistant said I was a size smaller than Madonna!
quotes.Title: British Celebrity
quotes.Name: Anne Robinson

quotes.Text: Meeting sports athletes that are the best in the world is a thrill to this day.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Phil Knight

quotes.Text: If my real life was half as exciting as what is reported, I would be thrilled.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Gabrielle Union

quotes.Text: It's a total thrill to be helping to bring the Teletubbies back to life.
quotes.Title: English Actor
quotes.Name: Daniel Rigby

quotes.Text: It's an honour and a thrill and a privilege just to play in the NHL.
quotes.Title: Canadian Hockey Player
quotes.Name: Wayne Gretzky

quotes.Text: I search for thrill in my characters because I am a boring person.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Mohit Raina

quotes.Text: I'm thrilled to be partnered up with SeaWorld.
quotes.Title: Australian Actress
quotes.Name: Bindi Irwin

quotes.Text: My big thrill in life is my Jaguar XKE.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: Dave Clark
